item.title: Comment on Europeans deserve to be as cool as Americans by JK
item.description:
I'm an American residing in Italy. Italians over the age of 50 are obsessed with the idea that fans and air conditioning- generally breezes of any type - cause a range of health problems (most notably a stiff neck). Younger people seem to be okay with it and I see it in more and more places. That's said, they'll also not set it at a comfortable level for me. Just cool enough to make it bearable in the room.
Per your description, Italians tend to take off the month of August and either go to the Sea or go to the mountains. My wife's family goes to the Alps and that's where we are. Frankly, it doesn't suck.
